ratings.comment: A very organized instructor and an easy A class. Most homework is graded by completion, and the essays can get a nearly full mark as long as comments are addressed with effort. She made the boring content highly engaging, and the feedback she gave was very straightforward. However, be careful with the presentations.

Getting an A in Stella's ESL 118 is not too difficult if you put in effort to complete each assignment. The feedback provided is straightforward and helpful. Stella truly makes 118 a class that enhances writing skills, rather than just being a dull requirement. The workload of the summer online version is also lighter than I expected.

Stella is strict but she always tells the expectations and requirements ahead of time.  If you don't understand something  she meets with you and explains.  She gives a lot of detailed feedbacks on essays. She really cares that you understand and learn.  She's kind even if you forget, she gives extensions.  I wish I can take another class with her!

Her altitude is totally not respecting student at all. At the same time class is totally helpless and she always tries to pick your problem. 
I paid lots of efforts but I cannot stand her at all.

If you wish to get an A in ESL 118, don't ever choose Stella! She is very strict with every detail, she gives the harshest feedback to you for even the slightest mistake, and she doesn't care about your available time, and she might even ask you to REWRITE your entire paper in the last week. DO NOT choose Stella as your ESL 118 instructor!

Stella is an overall great professor. She gives very clear feedback and guides you through the process of improving your work. She is very kind and offers individual help when necessary. If you put in effort she will help you succeed.
Stella was probably my favorite professor during my first semester at Madison. She really cared about her students and gave great feedback whenever possible. The grading criteria was also very clear.

Stella is an amazing teacher. She has high standard, but she also makes clear what she expects at the beginning. She's very accessible and offers a lot of help outside of class if needed. The feedback she gives is helpful to make improvement, and she never uses discouraging word. Even though her class has many work to do, you can really learn a lot

Stella is a really nice instructor from my experience. Sometimes she may delay the deadline and send emails if she found someone (like me) forgot to submit the assignment. She's a little strict grader, but not too much homework. She is fun and like make jokes. She always makes a good and happy atmosphere. Miss her.

Stella is an amazing instructor, and she not only makes the dull ESL course more interesting but she also gives very good feedbacks. At the same time, she was being very caring to her students. A very nice teacher!

She is a strict grader but kind, if you are absent from class, habitually late, then you may fail. She will tell you all the requirements in the first class. If you can finish it, then you may feel easy. If you want to try to fool her or late for homework, it is impossible. She is very timely in her feedback on the homework, and the email response.

Stella is really a good teacher, really responsive. She never show your bad mood in class. Her revision and advice about the essay are the most helpful feedback I ever get in English class. She also prepares cookies during peer revision! Really a lovely lecturer.
Stella is the worst instructor I ever met in this school. While I was trying to communicate with her about my grades, she didn't even reply emails and that is very rude.
She's a really nice instructor. I am really lucky to have her for my ESL 117! A tough grader, but really help you build up your writing skills for further level writing classes. Love her so much!
Lectures boring as hell. Participation policy is tougher than other teachers from the same class for no reason.
Prof. Stella is absolutely amazing Teacher.

At one time I forgot to turn in my hard copy of a homework, instead I turned in an electrical version on time, and she gave me 0/100 point for that and didn't give me any chance to fix it which caused me FAIL. Her lecture is boring as hell. DO NOT PICK HER CLASS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
She pretty tough grader. I think she is a subjective grader, because sometimes when comparing with scores with other classmates, I did not understand how she gave those scores.
